body: Hi Sarith, In theory it should be possible but there are couple of challenges. 1. importIdf component is not stable. I initially wrote it as a hack/proof of concept so it doesn't catch everything. 2. You need an extra script to return glazing construction. This one is very easy. 3. You need to have an algorithm to calculate the value for multi-layer glazing. Window does that but the version to run from the command line wasn't free. There might be still a way to do that though. Rob somehow does it for OpenStudio. Also there are different glass types in EnergyPlus. Here is the workflow: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/pip6g4jx0sc2pzTAozZJ3TMjCaAR2DIlK6XXTPUxh8ofPEKPgt1U3YARaZOCoGyGdFvGjyddHjaxCAkSD-goUkKrT3KohNHx/getEPTransValue.png)
